page.title: 07Pottlelake
page.content: Pottlelake is a small group of houses which is considered part of the small but very sprawling hamlet of Umborne. A thatched cottage, adjoining a tiled cottage is a place of unusual interest. It was originally a carpenter's cottage, then was converted into a church in late Victorain times. A branch of the Presbyterian Church (Yhe Irvinites used the building for many years, then it was taken over by the Church of England and used until 1981 as a Chapel-at-Ease of Colyton parish. Poor attendances caused closure and now it is used as summer-let accomodation. All the stained glass windows remain and with its well kept thatched roof it is a very attractive building.
